{"step_by_step_thinking": "Benign intracranial hypertension is a condition characterized by increased intracranial pressure without a detectable cause. The main symptoms include headache, vision problems, ringing in the ears, and shoulder pain. One of the hallmark features of benign intracranial hypertension is papilledema, which is swelling of the optic disc. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Papilledema.", "answer_choice": "D"}
